an airline trade group, said the safety of passengers and crew members is its No. 1 priority. "Making improvements is a continuous process," ATA spokeswoman Jean Medina said in an e-mailed statement. The rules, as written, will not improve safety, and regulations that are based neither on science nor operational experience should be rejected. U.S. Sen.
